data.title: The Faces of Franklin
data.meta_description: I’m 84 yrs. old and retired. I have 2 sons, a daughter-in-law and 2 grands.         Q: Please tell us a little bit about your family. Been married 60 yrs. come October...
data.text:
Q: Please tell us a little bit about your family.

Been married 60 yrs. come October

Q: Please tell us about your current, past, or future career. What do you love most about what you do?

I worked for attorneys in Alabama

Q: What are a couple of your favorite restaurants in our community?

Garcia’s

Q: How long have you lived here and where are you from originally if not from here?

We’ve lived here almost 11 yrs…. Moved here from Huntsville, Al.

Q: Who is the most interesting person you’ve met here in our community?

Steve and Marijean Green..

Q: If you could travel anywhere in the world right now, where would it be and why?

Switzerland because of family roots..

Q: What is one of your favorite movies? TV shows?

Blue Bloods and Sound of Music

Q: What advice would you give to people?

Don’t give lots of advice, but believe in yourself..

Q: What is something on your bucket list?

No bucket list—just enjoy life each day as best I can..

Q: What is your favorite style of music?

Oldies—Johnny Mathis, Tony Bennett

Q: What current or former local business makes you the most nostalgic about our community?

All the old buildings in downtown that house little shops.

Q: If you could choose anyone that is alive today and not a relative; with whom would you love to have lunch? Why? And where locally would y’all meet for this lunch?

Dolly Parton at Pucketts.. Live to hear about all the contributions she has made to help children..

Q: What is your favorite thing or something unique about our community?

Walking around downtown Franklin and looking at all the old homes and wondering about the history of each one.

Q: Where do you see yourself in 5 to 10 years?

At my age—hope I’m still around!

Q: What is something interesting that most people don’t know about you?

I’ve been a singer all my life.

Q: What is the most beautiful place that you have ever been?

Hard one—Grand Canyon showing God’s beautiful creation.

Q: What is your favorite month? Holiday? And best single day of the year?

October because I love fall. Holiday is Christmas with all the beautiful lights and reading the Christmas story from the Bible.

Q: Who inspires you to be better?

My friends.

Q: What is one or two of your favorite smells?

Bread baking.
